Event.name: Cause_change_of_strength
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> causes a <fen>Patient</fen> to be more strong, often resulting in something that is more secure and safe.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Local Serbs</fex> are <t>strengthening</t> <fex name="Patient">their grip on a narrow corridor along the Sava River between two large Serbian areas</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Patient
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that is being made stronger. </def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An act performed by an <fen>Agent</fen> that enables them to act upon the <fen>Patient</fen>.</def-root >

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> makes the <fen>Patient</fen> stronger.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location at which the <fen>Agent</fen> fortifies the <fen>Patient</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition: <def-root>An event which causes the <fen>Patient</fen> to become stronger.</def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which </def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> of the world at the time of the event (which do not bear directly on the event itself).</def-root>

lexUnit.name: fortify.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: make stronger, more able to resist or exert force.
